title: College Students Have to Learn How to Make Small Talk Again
sub_head: Remote learning and overdependence on screens have left college students anxious about interacting in real life; instructors are developing ways to stoke conversation
body:
When students at San Jose State University returned to campus last fall after more than a year of remote learning, lecturer Damon Moon thought they would be chatty and excited to see one another. Instead, he noticed something concerning: They werenâ€™t talking at all.
Before class, students were looking at their phones or laptops. Even in the campus cafeteria, Mr. Moon saw that most students were eating alone, sandwich in one hand, phone in the other.
